Males of
Tafana riveti
resemble those of
T. straminea
,
T. kunturmarqa
sp. nov. ,
T. humahuaca
sp. nov. and
T. nevada
sp. nov. , by the apophysis at the base of the embolus short, but differ by retrolateral tibial apophysis short and with large base in retrolateral view and visible subtegulum on palp when not expanded ( Fig. 10C–E ). Females differ from those of other species by the short atrium, triangular hood and lateral lobe curved in the anterior region and sclerotized ( Fig. 10F ).
